name: 8Intro
_source: # Back in the chapter 1 village - Cecelia's pegasus flies by
speak;Eirika;Don't forget to buy the milk!
speak;Charles;I was the one who reminded you!
speak;Eirika;Course you will or course you wont?
# Charles exits the house and meets a guy
speak;VillagerMaddy2;Remember that princess,{w} who once lived around here...
speak;Benson;Come on Malachy!{w}{clear}Put your back into it!
speak;Farmhand;Back at the village,{w} there were several scattered along the ground.
speak;Benson;Ah?{w}{clear}Here, can you read it out to me?{w}{clear}I can't see.

speak;Farmhand;Okay -{w} let's see.{w}{clear}"To my father, the honourable Duke of Setanta, Boris Nelson Peter Patrick Ebbitt Gabriel Ewing O'Rourke Monroe,{w} and to the people of this country to which he is indebted to..."

speak;;"I am writing to you in a public letter in an attempt to appeal to your better judgement,{w} an appeal that I recognize must first be prefaced with an apology.{w} I realize now how rash a decision of mine it was to run off with the prince Marcel Milieu without your prior knowledge or consent.{w} I should have made a concerted effort to convince you of his love for me and his desire to do right for both our countries.{w}I regret the loss of the opportunity immensely,{w} knowing that if I had had the patience,{w} we would not find ourselves in the position that we are in now...";center;;narration;;;;;8
# Transition - the governor's house at Wolfstock

speak;;You wish to stop Marcel's passage because you view him as a criminal,{w} but as far as I can see,{w} the only crime he has committed is mere act of loving me,{w} and it is for this that you wish to punish him,{w} and punish me,{w} for doing what comes naturally to ourselves.{w} This vindictive and immature abuse of power -{w} for what else would you call this persecution which has is no logical or rational justification? -{w} must cease immediately,{w} both for the good of the country,{w} and for our own personal well-being.{w} If you were to take away Marcel,{w} I would be left with nothing left to live for.{w} I know I would throw away my life if I were forced to be separated from him.{w} If you think that you can take him away from me,{w} and bring me back to live with you,{w} you are living in a past era with a spent future...;center;;narration;;;;;8

speak;;The days where we could live together in peace have long since past.{w} You have to accept the fact that I have grown, Father.{w} You must accept that fact,{w} that indisputable fact,{w} that I have grown older,{w} that I will never grow younger,{w} and that I will never be young again.{w} I am old enough to make my own decisions, and I am strong enough to bear the consequences of their outcomes.{w} I am aware that if I cross the border,{w} I will never see you again...;center;;narration;;;;;8

speak;;"...and thinking of it brings me to tears,{w} to think that I will never see you again,{w} that we will never speak again.{w} That you will never again consider us father and daughter.{w} And that all this cannot be avoided,{w} and can never be changed.{w} Regardless,{w} it is a decision that I must make,{w} it is something that I must do.{w} I know that I must leave behind my life here,{w} my country of birth,{w} in order to continue living,{w} even though it leaves inside a part of me to die.{w} I know that the grief of leaving you behind may kill me,{w} I know that I may forever regret the decision I've made for the rest of my life -{w} I may -{w} I may -{w} but I know -{w} I know that regardless of how happily I may live here,{w} that life would forever be tainted by the thoughts of the happiness I may have had in the life I have imagined,{w} in the life I've yet to live.{w} I beg of you, Father,{w} please,{w} do not deny me the potential to be happy.{w} Allow us to cross the border.{w} I will always be your loving daughter.{w}{clear}Madeline Milieu.";center;;narration;;;;;8
speak;Boris;If we kill Marcel, we as good as kill my daughter.{w}{clear}But we can't let them escape.

speak;Boris;Madeline is still too young to understand the transience of such feelings.{w}{clear}People are very adept at trickery, in regards to themselves especially.{w}{clear}They can convince themselves they love someone without ever knowing who they are,{w} invent all sorts of reasons,{w} connect the imaginary lines in the sky,{w} and believe that their love is written in the stars,{w}but there is a high difference between conviction,{w} and knowledge.{w}{clear}Madeline, in this letter,{w} displays conviction.{w}{clear}But it is clear,{w} in regards to Marcel,{w} in regards to love,{w} that she doesn't know a thing.{w}{clear}It would be a fatal mistake to let her go.{w}{clear}But we can't kill him.
speak;Fintan;So we capture him?{w}{clear}But won't there then be a risk of war with Crucible?
speak;Boris;No matter how formidable their military,{w} Crucible would not want to fight a war on two fronts.{w}{clear}As long as we leave them the option of negotiation,{w} they won't declare war.
speak;Boris;I suppose we'll let the Crucibellians go.
speak;Fintan;After all they've done?{w}{clear}All they people they've injured?{w}{clear}All the people they've killed?
speak;Fintan;Won't her mental state be significantly altered by the departure of Marcel?

speak;Boris;As long as he's kept alive,{w} then regardless of how long she is parted,{w}{clear}a part of her heart will nuture the believe that they'll one day be together again,{w} which will keep her going until she meets a new man,{w} and then,{w} whether she likes it or not,{w} she'll be swept off her feet,{w} and Marcel then will merely be subject of a fleeting adolescent memory,{w} a comforting piece of nostalgia perhaps -{w} but nothing more.
speak;Boris;Tell Chelsea to deliver this message.{w}{clear}In the meantime, ready the troops.{w}{clear}When they return with a rejection,{w} that is your cue to attack.
speak;Boris;You are a fine soldier, Fintan.{w}{clear}I trust you will keep this conversation between us.
speak;Anthony;So the letters have been delivered?
speak;Cecelia;What did you think I was doing the whole time -{w} hey,{w} where's Simone,{w} I'd like to talk to her.
speak;Anthony;She's somewhere near the stables -{w} look,{w} thank you for your help.
speak;Cecelia;Yeah, don't mention it,{w} it's just my job.{w}{clear}By the way,{w} how'd you manage to write so many letters in such a short space of time?
speak;Anthony;Madeline wrote the original letter,{w} and we had one of our magicians, Claude,{w} duplicate the original.
speak;Cecelia;I hope you've paid him at least.
# Marcel moves out from one of the tents
speak;Anthony;Marcel, the letters have been delivered.
speak;Marcel;We were just going over the plan again.
speak;Anthony;Is it the same plan as before?
speak;Anthony;To call it a plan then is very generous indeed.
speak;Marcel;Striking before the enemy can strike back is a strategy of sorts.
speak;Anthony;A strategy employed by every amateur in history.
speak;Marcel;Anyway, once a battle starts,{w} all strategy goes out the window.
speak;Anthony;That seems to be our way of doing it.
speak;Marcel;And it's worked so far,{w} hasn't it?
speak;Anthony;Some would call it a fluke.
speak;Marcel;We've made it out alive,{w} and that's the main thing.
speak;Marcel;Hey, Madeline,{w} the letter's been delivered.
speak;Madeline;I don't think it's going to make much of a difference.
speak;Chelsea;Message for Anthony and Marcel Milieu,{w} on behalf of his Excellency the head of state Duke Boris Nelson Peter Patrick Ebbitt Gabriel Ewing O'Rourke Monroe.
speak;Marcel;What we expected.{w}{clear}Boris wants me to hand over Madeline and Norris or otherwise he'll attack.
speak;Marcel;I suppose we should get ready then.
# Marcel and Anthony and Madeline walk around the tents.
speak;Marcel;James, Claude, Claudia,{w} we're all ready to go,{w} come on!
speak;James;Want me to perform your last rites before we leave?
speak;Marcel;Are you sure you want to fight, Claude?
speak;Claude;What else am I supposed to do?
speak;Marcel;I know you didn't want to put Claudia in danger.
speak;Claudia;Don't worry.{w}{clear}If this idiot James can survive on a battlefield,{w} anyone can.
speak;James;Marcel,{w} why are these kids so mean to me?
speak;Hamsen;We're ready to go, your royal highness.{w}{clear}Alice?
speak;Madeline;Cindy, Simone, Cecelia!{w}{clear}Get your gear ready and round up all the rest!
speak;Simone;Yeah, in a minute,{w} just give me sec...
speak;Cecelia;Typical Simone.{w}{clear}Always leaving everything to the last minute.
